content:
Diagnosis:	Squamous cell carcinoma right temple

Management:	15 Jan 2024 Wide local excision with 6mm margins

Histology:	Moderately differentiated squamous cell carcinoma, 12mm diameter, 2.1mm depth
	Complete excision with margins >4mm
	No lymphovascular invasion

Current Situation:	Routine follow-up

I reviewed [redacted name] today following his wide local excision of right temple squamous cell carcinoma in January. The surgical site has healed well with an acceptable cosmetic outcome. He has no new skin lesions or concerning symptoms. The right temple area shows a well-healed 2cm scar with no evidence of recurrence. There is no palpable lymphadenopathy in the head and neck region.

I have performed a complete skin examination today which shows no new suspicious lesions. We have discussed sun protection measures and skin surveillance. He will continue with 3-monthly skin checks with his local dermatologist. I will review him again in 6 months' time with repeat photography.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: moderately differentiated squamous cell carcinoma, 12mm diameter, 2.1mm depth, no lymphovascular invasion

cancer_timeline.value: Wide local excision with 6mm margins, complete excision achieved with margins >4mm
Surgical site well-healed with no evidence of recurrence

patient_facts.value: Well-healed 2cm scar at right temple site
No palpable lymphadenopathy in head and neck region
No new suspicious skin lesions on complete skin examination

status_updates.value: Early stage right temple SCC treated with surgical excision. Post-operative review shows good healing with no evidence of recurrence
Continue 3-monthly dermatology checks and oncology review in 6 months with photography
